titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Ministers' Association of New York records 1899-1930
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Ministers' Association of New York records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Ministers' Association of New York was organized in 1869 for the purpose of mutual fellowship. The members met regularly to hear papers read and to hold discussions on a variety of topics. Members of the Association were ministers of Presbyterian, Reformed, and Congregational churches in New York City and vicinity.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of the Presbyterian Ministers' Association of New York. The minutes discuss routine business and include the constitution and bylaws, some financial statements, several printed programs, and listings of papers read at meetings. Topics of addresses include "The Virgin Birth -- a Reaffirmation," "Civil Government, Religious Liberty and Morals," "The Minister's Salary," "The Real Mormon Problem Today," "Can God Forgive Sin?" and "Obstacles to Prison Reform." A history scrapbook, 1900-1907, includes correspondence, memorial minutes, and manuscript historical sketches. The collection also includes an undated membership book.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
